text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen so 
I get a lot of requests for an eggplant stir-fry

recipe but for one reason or another I just never 
got around to doing it but today is the day and

if you have my cookbook you know that there is 
an eggplant sir fry recipe in the book but this

one is going to use a little bit of a different 
technique and it's also a different sauce so if

you have the book try both and see which one you 
like better all right it's super easy let's get

started so we're start with the sauce I've got 
here some soy sauce this is Thai soy sauce you

don't have to use Thai soy sauce any kind of soy 
sauce would do I'm going to add some fish sauce to

this and you know people ask me why do you have to 
use both fish sauce and soy sauce because you know

they're both salty sauces well people have very 
different flavors and when you combine them you

get a more sort of more complex flavor of course 
you can just use one or the other if you don't

have both oyster sauce oyster sauce soy sauce and 
fish sauce this is what I call the Trinity of stir

fry sauce together the three of them any surprise 
good with these sauces now the main ingredients

or the sauce for this is Thai chili paste or numpy 
pow now I have a recipe for how you can make this

from scratch if you can't buy it this is not the 
only brand that there is but it seems to be the

most widely available brand my favourite brand is 
actually called mera naam so this is quite sweet

this brand especially so because I'm using quite 
a bit of the chili paste I'm not going to add any

sugar at all if you're using a different brand or 
if you're making your own you may have to adjust

for the sugar a little bit at the end and I'm 
just going to thin this out with some water and

with a mini whisk give it a quick mix oh and as 
an FYI there is dried shrimp in Thai chili paste

for those of you with shrimp allergies something 
to think about okay that's the sauce super easy

now let's deal with the eggplant so eggplant so I 
am using a Chinese eggplant sometimes it's called

a Japanese eggplant in Thailand we use a similar 
eggplant looks exactly like this except it's green

rather than purple so either would work what I 
done here so I have to slice them into pieces

like this and how I did that is first I slice it 
into rounds on the bias and then I cut each round

in half so the first thing I'm going to do is pre 
sear the eggplant so in my cookbook I talk about

first deep frying the eggplant before you stir 
fry it today I'm going to show you a different

technique that I discovered that works just as 
well and that is pre searing the eggplant and

the reason why I mean you could just throw the 
eggplant in the wok that just cook it cook it

all in one go but I find that if you do that the 
eggplant just ends up being a little bit mushy

who takes so long to cook in the sauce this way it 
will cook most of the way here and then when you

throw it in the wok which is be very quick and if 
the dish looks better in general like that so I'm

just going to heat a flat skillet and then once 
it's hot just going to put the eggplant down and

then you wanted to flip them so they are the flat 
side is being seared you may have to do this twice

if you have a smaller pan and you just want to 
let that sear until it's nice and browned on one

side okay so the bottom side is starting to brown 
I'm going to flip them it doesn't need to cook all

the way get it you know medium rare okay so now 
that the other side's a little bit browned we can

remove them and you don't have to remove all of 
them at once you'll notice that the pieces with a

lot of seeds will tend to cook faster because it's 
not as dense the pieces from sort of the top part

of the eggplant will take a little longer to cook 
because it's just a little bit denser and then

as it sits in this bowl it will also continue to 
steam in each other's heat and that will cook it a

little bit further alright a couple of ingredients 
before we get started so I've got here some ground

chicken that I'm going to use for protein I love 
ground meat with eggplant I don't know something

about the texture of the tools works really 
well together you can do ground pork you can do

even crumbled tofu I wouldn't do ground beef just 
because the flavors bit strong in here I have some

garlic and some chilies which I'm going to pound 
in my smaller more PESTEL if you notice and I've

chosen some big Chili's because they're less spicy 
and it gives me a lot more color than if I were to

go with the tiny little one try not to look at it 
because it can jump into your eye if the smell is

any indication I think that's going to be a lot 
spicier than I thought it would be alright now we

are ready to go I'm going to transfer my garlic 
and chilli paste into the wok put a little oil

in there and turn the heat up and I just start the 
garlic and chilies on sort of medium heat you know

the garlic to burn too quickly you want to give 
it some time to infuse into the oil so the garlic

starting to brown out smells really good and we're 
going with the chicken and and I'm going to just

try to break that up and what I find especially 
with commercially ground chicken this is really

fit they grinded really fine so a splash of 
water helps loosen it up a bit it becomes a

little easier to to break it apart for some reason 
it's so sticky otherwise the chicken is about 80%

done now I am going to add the eggplant all of 
it Adams dying over there with the fumes of the

chilies and the sauce goes in you're right I'm 
sorry okay this will be quick and now I'm just

going to mix this just until the eggplant is 
fully fully cooked because at this point the

eggplant is is kind of partially cooked oh that 
looks good and see if you don't pre cook the

eggplant this step takes a long time it's not as 
hot here now with all the liquid so that's why you

either want to pre deep fry it or pretty spear it 
mmm that looks delicious now to finish everything

off I've got some Thai basil hmm lots of Thai 
basil and I'm going to turn that off just toss

it together until the Thai basil is wilted and 
that's it how easy is that those eggplant pieces

just look delicious I just love the texture of 
eggplant when it's done it's so soft and silky

all right now you definitely want to 
serve this with rice and since I have

so much different colored right now instead of 
white rice I am going to have brown rice with

it this is brown jasmine rice best kind of 
brown rice there is and there isn't a lot of

sauce pooling at the bottom and that's because 
the eggplant has absorbed much of that sauce

mmm I love that Wow eggplant to me is such a 
magical vegetable I mean when it's raw it's

sort of this dry spongy foam styrofoam looking 
thing but when you cook it it just becomes soft

and juicy and almost melt in your mouth and 
it absorb any sauce you put around it is so

good when I was little I didn't like vegetables 
in general but the eggplant was definitely one

thing I always always loved it didn't even look 
to me like a vegetable is magical sauce sponge

so I hope you give this a try it's a little sweet 
a little spicy ooh I'm still copying from all the

chilies in the air but it's actually not as spicy 
as it looks the Thai basil floral and aromatic

title and eggplants just a match made in heaven 
so I hope you give it a try the recipe fo8 is on

hot hsn.com and when you make it to me a photo on 
Facebook Twitter or Instagram and if you love the

show and you'd like to support us check out my 
patreon page I'll put the link somewhere around

here and I will see you next time for your 
next finishing time you air out the room era
